2. Basics; Linear Algebra (2), Search (1)

ê³ ìœ ê°’ê³¼ ê³ ìœ ë²¡í„° (Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors)

ëŒ€ì¹­ í–‰ë ¬ (Symmetric Matrices)ì˜ ê³ ìœ ê°’ê³¼ ê³ ìœ ë²¡í„°

íŠ¹ì´ê°’ ë¶„í•´ (Singular Value Decomposition, SVD)

í–‰ë ¬ ë¯¸ì ë¶„ (Matrix Calculus)

ê¸°ìš¸ê¸° (The Gradient)

  • í•¨ìˆ˜ f:RmÃ—nâ†’Rf:\mathbb{R}^{m \times n} \to \mathbb{R}f:RmÃ—nâ†’Rì´ mÃ—nm \times nmÃ—n í¬ê¸°ì˜ í–‰ë ¬ AAAë¥¼ ì…ë ¥ìœ¼ë¡œ ë°›ê³  ì‹¤ìˆ˜ ê°’ì„ ë°˜í™˜í•œë‹¤ê³  ê°€ì •
  • AâˆˆRmÃ—nA \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n}AâˆˆRmÃ—nì— ëŒ€í•œ fffì˜ ê¸°ìš¸ê¸°(Gradient) âˆ‡Af(A)\nabla_A f(A)âˆ‡Aâ€‹f(A)ëŠ” í¸ë¯¸ë¶„ í–‰ë ¬ë¡œ ì •ì˜

âˆ‡Af(A)âˆˆRmÃ—n=[âˆ‚f(A)âˆ‚A11â‹¯âˆ‚f(A)âˆ‚A1nâ‹®â‹±â‹®âˆ‚f(A)âˆ‚Am1â‹¯âˆ‚f(A)âˆ‚Amn]\nabla_A f(A) \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n} = \begin{bmatrix} \frac{\partial f(A)}{\partial A_{11}} & \cdots & \frac{\partial f(A)}{\partial A_{1n}} \\ \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ \frac{\partial f(A)}{\partial A_{m1}} & \cdots & \frac{\partial f(A)}{\partial A_{mn}} \end{bmatrix} âˆ‡Aâ€‹f(A)âˆˆRmÃ—n=â€‹âˆ‚A11â€‹âˆ‚f(A)â€‹â‹®âˆ‚Am1â€‹âˆ‚f(A)â€‹â€‹â‹¯â‹±â‹¯â€‹âˆ‚A1nâ€‹âˆ‚f(A)â€‹â‹®âˆ‚Amnâ€‹âˆ‚f(A)â€‹â€‹â€‹

  • ì¦‰, âˆ‡Af(A)ij=âˆ‚f(A)âˆ‚Aij\nabla_A f(A)_{ij} = \frac{\partial f(A)}{\partial A_{ij}}âˆ‡Aâ€‹f(A)ijâ€‹=âˆ‚Aijâ€‹âˆ‚f(A)â€‹ì¸ mÃ—nm \times nmÃ—n í–‰ë ¬
  • AAAê°€ ë²¡í„° xâˆˆRn\mathbf{x} \in \mathbb{R}^nxâˆˆRnì¸ ê²½ìš°, ê¸°ìš¸ê¸° âˆ‡xf(x)\nabla_{\mathbf{x}} f(\mathbf{x})âˆ‡xâ€‹f(x)ëŠ”

âˆ‡xf(x)=[âˆ‚f(x)âˆ‚x1âˆ‚f(x)âˆ‚x2â‹®âˆ‚f(x)âˆ‚xn]\nabla_{\mathbf{x}} f(\mathbf{x}) = \begin{bmatrix} \frac{\partial f(\mathbf{x})}{\partial x_1} \\ \frac{\partial f(\mathbf{x})}{\partial x_2} \\ \vdots \\ \frac{\partial f(\mathbf{x})}{\partial x_n} \end{bmatrix} âˆ‡xâ€‹f(x)=â€‹âˆ‚x1â€‹âˆ‚f(x)â€‹âˆ‚x2â€‹âˆ‚f(x)â€‹â‹®âˆ‚xnâ€‹âˆ‚f(x)â€‹â€‹â€‹

  • ì†ì„±
    • âˆ‡x(f(x)+g(x))=âˆ‡xf(x)+âˆ‡xg(x)\nabla_{\mathbf{x}} (f(\mathbf{x}) + g(\mathbf{x})) = \nabla_{\mathbf{x}} f(\mathbf{x}) + \nabla_{\mathbf{x}} g(\mathbf{x})âˆ‡xâ€‹(f(x)+g(x))=âˆ‡xâ€‹f(x)+âˆ‡xâ€‹g(x)
    • tâˆˆRt \in \mathbb{R}tâˆˆR, âˆ‡x(tf(x))=tâˆ‡xf(x)\nabla_{\mathbf{x}} (t f(\mathbf{x})) = t \nabla_{\mathbf{x}} f(\mathbf{x})âˆ‡xâ€‹(tf(x))=tâˆ‡xâ€‹f(x)

í—¤ì‹œì•ˆ (The Hessian)

  • í•¨ìˆ˜ f:Rnâ†’Rf:\mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}f:Rnâ†’Rì´ Rn\mathbb{R}^nRnì˜ ë²¡í„°ë¥¼ ì…ë ¥ìœ¼ë¡œ ë°›ê³  ì‹¤ìˆ˜ ê°’ì„ ë°˜í™˜í•œë‹¤ê³  ê°€ì •
  • x\mathbf{x}xì— ëŒ€í•œ í—¤ì‹œì•ˆ í–‰ë ¬(Hessian matrix) HHH ë˜ëŠ” âˆ‡x2f(x)\nabla_{\mathbf{x}}^2 f(\mathbf{x})âˆ‡x2â€‹f(x)ëŠ” nÃ—nn \times nnÃ—n í¸ë¯¸ë¶„ í–‰ë ¬

Hij=âˆ‚2f(x)âˆ‚xiâˆ‚xjH_{ij} = \frac{\partial^2 f(\mathbf{x})}{\partial x_i \partial x_j} Hijâ€‹=âˆ‚xiâ€‹âˆ‚xjâ€‹âˆ‚2f(x)â€‹

  • í—¤ì‹œì•ˆì€ í•­ìƒ ëŒ€ì¹­
  • ìœ ì¶” (Analogy)
    • ê¸°ìš¸ê¸°ëŠ” ë²¡í„° í•¨ìˆ˜ì— ëŒ€í•œ 1ì°¨ ë„í•¨ìˆ˜ì˜ ìœ ì¶”
    • í—¤ì‹œì•ˆì€ 2ì°¨ ë„í•¨ìˆ˜ì˜ ìœ ì¶”

2ì°¨ ë° ì„ í˜• í•¨ìˆ˜ì˜ ê¸°ìš¸ê¸° (Gradients of Quadratic and Linear Functions)

  • xâˆˆRn,Â f(x)=bTxÂ (bâˆˆRn)\mathbf{x} \in \mathbb{R}^n,~f(\mathbf{x}) = \mathbf{b}^T \mathbf{x}~ ( \mathbf{b} \in \mathbb{R}^n )xâˆˆRn,Â f(x)=bTxÂ (bâˆˆRn)ì— ëŒ€í•´,

    f(x)=âˆ‘i=1nbixi,âˆ‚f(x)âˆ‚xk=âˆ‚âˆ‚xkâˆ‘i=1nbixi=bkf(\mathbf{x}) = \sum_{i=1}^n b_i x_i, \quad \frac{\partial f(\mathbf{x})}{\partial x_k} = \frac{\partial}{\partial x_k} \sum_{i=1}^n b_i x_i = b_k f(x)=i=1âˆ‘nâ€‹biâ€‹xiâ€‹,âˆ‚xkâ€‹âˆ‚f(x)â€‹=âˆ‚xkâ€‹âˆ‚â€‹i=1âˆ‘nâ€‹biâ€‹xiâ€‹=bkâ€‹

    • âˆ‡xbTx=b\nabla_{\mathbf{x}} \mathbf{b}^T \mathbf{x} = \mathbf{b}âˆ‡xâ€‹bTx=b
  • 2ì°¨ í•¨ìˆ˜ f(x)=xTAxf(\mathbf{x}) = \mathbf{x}^T A \mathbf{x}f(x)=xTAx (AâˆˆSnA \in \mathbb{S}^nAâˆˆSn)ì— ëŒ€í•´,
    • âˆ‡xxTAx=2Ax\nabla_{\mathbf{x}} \mathbf{x}^T A \mathbf{x} = 2A\mathbf{x}âˆ‡xâ€‹xTAx=2Ax

ìµœì†Œ ì œê³±ë²• (Least Squares)

  • í–‰ë ¬ AâˆˆRmÃ—nA \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n}AâˆˆRmÃ—nì™€ ë²¡í„° bâˆˆRm\mathbf{b} \in \mathbb{R}^mbâˆˆRmì´ ì£¼ì–´ì§€ê³ , bâˆ‰R(A)\mathbf{b} \notin \mathcal{R}(A)bâˆˆ/R(A)ì¸ ê²½ìš°,
  • Ax=bA\mathbf{x} = \mathbf{b}Ax=bë¥¼ ë§Œì¡±í•˜ëŠ” ë²¡í„° xâˆˆRn\mathbf{x} \in \mathbb{R}^nxâˆˆRnë¥¼ ì°¾ì„ ìˆ˜ ì—†ìŒ.
  • ëŒ€ì‹ , ìœ í´ë¦¬ë“œ normì˜ ì œê³± âˆ¥Axâˆ’bâˆ¥22\Vert A\mathbf{x} - \mathbf{b} \Vert_2^2âˆ¥Axâˆ’bâˆ¥22â€‹ìœ¼ë¡œ ì¸¡ì •í–ˆì„ ë•Œ, AxA\mathbf{x}Axê°€ b\mathbf{b}bì— ê°€ëŠ¥í•œ í•œ ê°€ì¥ ê°€ê¹ë„ë¡ ë§Œë“œëŠ” ë²¡í„° x\mathbf{x}xë¥¼ ì°¾ê³ ì í•¨
  • âˆ¥xâˆ¥22=xTx\Vert \mathbf{x} \Vert_2^2 = \mathbf{x}^T \mathbf{x}âˆ¥xâˆ¥22â€‹=xTxë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ì—¬

âˆ¥Axâˆ’bâˆ¥22=(Axâˆ’b)T(Axâˆ’b)=xTATAxâˆ’2bTAx+bTb\Vert A\mathbf{x} - \mathbf{b} \Vert_2^2 = (A\mathbf{x} - \mathbf{b})^T (A\mathbf{x} - \mathbf{b}) = \mathbf{x}^T A^T A\mathbf{x} - 2\mathbf{b}^T A\mathbf{x} + \mathbf{b}^T \mathbf{b} âˆ¥Axâˆ’bâˆ¥22â€‹=(Axâˆ’b)T(Axâˆ’b)=xTATAxâˆ’2bTAx+bTb

  • x\mathbf{x}xì— ëŒ€í•´ ê¸°ìš¸ê¸°ë¥¼ ì·¨í•˜ê³  0ìœ¼ë¡œ ì„¤ì •

âˆ‡x(xTATAxâˆ’2bTAx+bTb)=âˆ‡xxTATAxâˆ’âˆ‡x2bTAx+âˆ‡xbTb\nabla_{\mathbf{x}} (\mathbf{x}^T A^T A\mathbf{x} - 2\mathbf{b}^T A\mathbf{x} + \mathbf{b}^T \mathbf{b}) = \nabla_{\mathbf{x}} \mathbf{x}^T A^T A\mathbf{x} - \nabla_{\mathbf{x}} 2\mathbf{b}^T A\mathbf{x} + \nabla_{\mathbf{x}} \mathbf{b}^T \mathbf{b} âˆ‡xâ€‹(xTATAxâˆ’2bTAx+bTb)=âˆ‡xâ€‹xTATAxâˆ’âˆ‡xâ€‹2bTAx+âˆ‡xâ€‹bTb

=2ATAxâˆ’2ATb=0= 2A^T A\mathbf{x} - 2A^T \mathbf{b} = \mathbf{0} =2ATAxâˆ’2ATb=0

âˆ´x=(ATA)âˆ’1ATb\therefore \mathbf{x} = (A^T A)^{-1} A^T \mathbf{b} âˆ´x=(ATA)âˆ’1ATb
